heading: # Paginations
headingText: The `v-pagination` component is used to separate long sets of data so that it is easier for a user to consume information. Depending on the length provided, the pagination component will automatically scale. To maintain the current page, simply supply a `v-model` attribute.

usage.desc: Pagination by default displays the number of pages based on the set `length` prop, with `prev` and `next` buttons surrounding to help you navigate.

long.heading: ### Long
long.desc: Using the `length` prop you can set the length of `v-pagination`, if the number of page buttons exceeds the parent container, it will truncate the list.

limit.heading: ### Limit
limit.desc: You can also manually set the maximum number of visible page buttons with the `total-visible` prop.

circle.heading: ### Circle
circle.desc: The `circle` prop gives you an alternate style for pagination buttons.

icons.heading: ### Icons
icons.desc: Previous and next page icons can be customized with the `prev-icon` and `next-icon` props.

disabled.heading: ### Disabled
disabled.desc: Pagination items can be manually deactivated using the `disabled` prop.

events.previous: Emitted when going to previous item
events.next: Emitted when going to next item

props.length: The length of the pagination component
props.nextIcon: Specify the icon to use for the next icon
props.prevIcon: Specify the icon to use for the prev icon
props.totalVisible: Specify the max total visible pagination numbers
